title: How to Create a Funky Numbered Dresser

steps.headline: Consider what type of update the dresser requires.
steps.description: Does your dresser need to be stripped and re-painted or stained? Or can you simply change out drawer pulls and add numbers?

steps.headline: Determine if furniture is in workable order.
steps.description: If the piece is falling over and has weak legs, you may want to think about retiring it forever. However, if the basic bones are in good shape it may be a piece you can salvage. Have an expert evaluate the piece if you are working with an antique or a family heirloom. Something this valuable may not be a good idea for a novice furniture restoration artist so call in the pros instead.

steps.headline: Sketch out how the piece will look with new drawer pulls, large numbers down the middle (or side) and a new finish.
Identify overall finish.
steps.description: Whether it’s a new paint job or stain, have an idea of the color/tone and how it will be integrated into your room.

steps.headline: Shop for hardware.
steps.description: A wide variety of furniture, hardware and craft stores offer an endless number of drawer pull styles and also house numbers that can be used on your dresser. Choose styles that either match or compliment each other. Look at styles in person and determine how finishes and styles will look together before making a decision.

steps.headline: Purchase furniture re-surfacing/painting or staining supplies.
steps.description: This includes sandpaper (or sanding equipment) and your choice of stain or paint. Consider adding a gloss or finish to the piece to protect and seal your work.

steps.headline: Commit to hardware.
steps.description: Pick up numbers (to correspond with the number of drawers) and drawer pulls. Consider any hinges or other hardware that you may need to include at this time.

steps.headline: Pick up any furniture repair supplies.
steps.description: If your dresser requires minor repair purchase necessary equipment such as nails, screws, etc.

steps.headline: Repair dresser if necessary.
steps.description: Make the necessary repairs in order for the piece is functional and stable.

steps.headline: Re-finish the dresser.
steps.description: Strip old paint or stain and then sand the piece until smooth. Remove debris and apply stain or paint. Allow time to dry and add another coat. Finish the piece by adding gloss or sealant.

steps.headline: Finish dresser by adding hardware.
steps.description: Use an electric screwdriver to add drawer pulls, numbers and any hinges.

text: Evaluate Furniture Piece Consider what type of update the dresser requires. Does your dresser need to be stripped and re-painted or stained? Or can you simply change out drawer pulls and add numbers? Determine if furniture is in workable order. If the piece is falling over and has weak legs, you may want to think about retiring it forever. However, if the basic bones are in good shape it may be a piece you can salvage. Have an expert evaluate the piece if you are working with an antique or a family heirloom. Something this valuable may not be a good idea for a novice furniture restoration artist so call in the pros instead. Consider Design Sketch out how the piece will look with new drawer pulls, large numbers down the middle (or side) and a new finish.  Identify overall finish. Whether it’s a new paint job or stain, have an idea of the color/tone and how it will be integrated into your room. Shop for hardware. A wide variety of furniture, hardware and craft stores offer an endless number of drawer pull styles and also house numbers that can be used on your dresser. Choose styles that either match or compliment each other. Look at styles in person and determine how finishes and styles will look together before making a decision. Shop for Supplies Purchase furniture re-surfacing/painting or staining supplies. This includes sandpaper (or sanding equipment) and your choice of stain or paint. Consider adding a gloss or finish to the piece to protect and seal your work. Commit to hardware. Pick up numbers (to correspond with the number of drawers) and drawer pulls. Consider any hinges or other hardware that you may need to include at this time. Pick up any furniture repair supplies. If your dresser requires minor repair purchase necessary equipment such as nails, screws, etc. Create Funky Numbered Dresser Repair dresser if necessary. Make the necessary repairs in order for the piece is functional and stable. Re-finish the dresser. Strip old paint or stain and then sand the piece until smooth. Remove debris and apply stain or paint. Allow time to dry and add another coat. Finish the piece by adding gloss or sealant. Finish dresser by adding hardware. Use an electric screwdriver to add drawer pulls, numbers and any hinges.
